message: I've been using Django's sessions to save some objects to avoid hitting the DB too often. This can cause annoyances when I need access to those the objects without access to the request.
Furthermore, any changes saved to the object in the DB are not reflected in the session object.
So would it be a better idea to implement this in the cache?
Which would lead me to believe that this just isn't a good approach, and session variables should be reserved for static data that won't change during the session
it sounds like you should look at something like Johnny Cache http://packages.python.org/johnny-cache/
